review_title: Fulfilling position, great people in many levels of management, high standards ( exp. w/ BHRS Services and Corporate)
job_title: Children's Behavior Therapist/TSS/BHW in Philadelphia, PA
pros: I adore this company. I've sat in free yoga classes with the CEO laid out next to me and in roundtable meetings with corporate to discuss our needs and hopes for our position and the field in terms of aiming to offer living wage for all. I have have incredibly meaningful relationships with clients watching them succeed and helping them adapt around their struggles with a supportive team both around and above me that was always accessible. Good hearted people who work hard and truly care and are on your side. We also have adult services that I have seen many happy clients in, some married. Great place to work, lots of promotion from within and leadership education courses offered. Benefits were so/so, kind of a high deductible but I was grateful for in a field mostly comprised of independent contractors, and that's where SPIN really breaks the mold and offers more than typical positions at other companies. Very high standards though, you WILL NOT be picking up a book or reading facebook during your shifts and if that's appealing to you honestly please do us a service and seek employment elsewhere.
cons: I have no complaints. I had a flexible position with benefits and a great team and clients to boot, even the rough ones I had support with and made things better before I left and learned to love each one.

pros: Inward hiring, holidays and time off
cons: Changing dynamics and fluctuating hours

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Philadelphia, PA

cons: Improve Management to work more for staffers

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Charlotte, NC
pros:
Great agency that provides services to adults and children with disabilities.  It was my honor and pleasure to work for them for over 15 years. A family oriented agency that treats employees (and those they serve) with dignity, respect, and I can truly say that this was the greatest employment experience that I ever had! S.P.I.N. provides a fun work atmosphere. At S.P.I.N., you will build strong relationships with both the staff and the people that receive services.

Other Pros:
1) Unionized Shop (at least when I worked there)
2) Complete training and assistance whenever needed
3) The potential for longevity - most employees had worked there for over 15 years.
4) Tuition Reimbursement - for career related coursework. 
5) Opportunity for growth from within as you complete your academic career - they prefer to promote internally for available management positions. 
6) Agency vehicles (for staff) were provided for transportation of residents, for many of the CLA's (Community Living group homes)
7) Good benefits package
8) 401 Thrift B (matching)  towards retirement 
9) A small company that knows how to dream big!
10) One of the highest ranking U.S. companies in training excellence

 It was not only the best company that I have ever worked for, but it is perhaps the best company of its kind.
cons: Benefits were good, not great, but were as good, if not better than what any similar agency or company had to offer.

pros: They have good medical benefit
cons: Schedules is made for you and not many hours

pros: Making your schedule, gas reimbursement, pay is ok, company phone and laptop, casual dress code, PTO and most holidays off, working remotely
cons: If you don’t enjoy driving all day, going from business to business asking if they are hiring, and supporting people at work which feels like babysitting...this job is not for you. You must be willing to work with individuals with disabilities and go into their homes sometimes. These are pros or cons depending on what you like. Communicating with my manager was difficult. We had monthly meetings and we would discuss the same thing every meeting leaving problems unsolved. She also missed a few scheduled meetings. There is a weekend rotation so you can work from 0-20 hours in a weekend and weekend shifts are usually only supports. Although you can make your own schedule, your manager can call you at any time and change it. Tuition reimbursement is only available to management positions but there aren’t many management positions open. Training is long but paid (minimum wage).

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Philadelphia, PA
pros: The individuals. Every one of them amazing. If not for anything else, this job will affect your life on ways you'll never forget.
cons: Not enough accountability towards staff not doing their jobs correctly. Overnight staff sleeping, staff treating individuals money and house money like it is staff enrichment, staff treating adult individuals like children instead of adults, watching tv and or talking on phone for entire shifts... You get what you pay for. Crap help. Then the "good staff" either hang in and bare with it or leave to find better employment (at the expense of the individuals quality of life more than anything else). Managers not really managing. Cliques EVERYWHERE, whether you're in lower or upper position. Good luck finding the one that is best for the individuals AND gets you anywhere.

pros: SPIN has a very supportive environment. The staff and management are encouraging in all aspects of the lives of employees. The senior managers take the time to get to know every employee! Even the CEO speaks to employees by name and builds a rapport with everyone in the company.  It is truly like a family atmosphere.
cons: The only con of working for SPIN in my opinion has been utilizing personal time on days when the office is closed for inclement weather days (that totally sucks).

pros: It was a good environment to work in , I love helping people that needs help and I love getting to know new people. This job is something new every day and I love that
cons: Some of the down sides of this job was that I just had a son and I couldn't work overnight any more and they did not have any positions for me at that location ..

pros: Decent pay, benefits if you're a 30 hour employee. Also holiday pay is a plus and you will receive up to 40 hours leave time.
cons: You're are mandated to call office if your client is out sick to cover for another client. They try to accommodate you to a close location from where you are. However, it depends on the coverage list and you may have to drive a bit far. Also, they make your schedule for you so it's not as flexible as other companies.

review_title: It's a nice place to work if you can deal with the management and low pay.
pros: They offer an innovative program for people who have special needs in a community center environment where members can engage in a variety of leisure activities such as music, movies, art, cooking, computers and gym activities. Additionally, the intent of the program is to integrate the center with the community so that non-disabled members can participate in activities alongside their neighbors with special needs.
cons: The administration is extraordinarily top-heavy. Most of those in upper administration/executive positions began in direct care positions 35 years ago and have worked their way up. The problem with this is that practically everyone who stuck it out became a "Vice President." Additionally, for many of them this was their first work experience and they therefore have had no other exposure to management styles, nor had education in management. As a group they are very clanish and do not allow outsiders into their clique. As a group they use a management style that was popular in the 1970s. which suggests that constant change keeps emplyees off-balance and they are therefore less inclined to complain. At least every 6 months people are moved around to different offices and/or buildings. Programs are revamped so that the direct care employees are also kept in a constant state of change. It is a very unnerving way to manage and eventually results in frustration among employees below the upper echelon and they end up losing a LOT of really good employees.

review_title: One of the best places I worked for.
pros: The individuals I worked with were awesome. The hours and pay was good ! The managers and supervisors were almost always available to speak with.
cons: A bit unorganized with shift scheduling and covering. I would get stuck at a location often. Also once you sign on for a permanent shift you are not allowed to change your hours.

review_title: A flexible job for those who have excellent interpersonal skills
pros:
Flexible hours (30 hr with health benefits) and I don’t feel over-worked. 

I have decent control over when I work. 

Managers are excellent (many of them have worked up from starting positions) —they understand the challenges with time management that come with the job
cons:
Sometimes communication which effects my schedule is not disseminated quickly. 

Administrative work can easily be overlooked.

pros: The individuals and the amount of PTO
cons: The amount of nepotism in the organization is unbearable and driving the good employees away and upper management could care less. The acceptance of those who do not do their job and the extra work that is given to good employees in turn. Negative and unapproachable attitudes of some in management positions and it is just ignored.

review_title: if you're willing to sacrifice who you are as person, this is the place for you
pros: The individuals. Working with them or just helping them can bring joy to your day.
cons: Management...there is no words to describe how inept management is at this organization. There is nepotism, favoritism and hypocritical behavior from the top.  Management will ask you to conform and if you don't you will be fired for a trumped up charge. There is a reason why there is such high turn around at SPIN

pros: There is nothing good about working here
cons: Fake people, everyone is related or grandfathered in, smile in your face and throw you under the bus.
